body:
Thanks for your reply Ian. I'm concerned that the justification for
changing the language is coming from the (unique?) needs of Google's
monorepo. Especially as the monorepo model has previously been held up as
_enabling_ wide ranging change.

Thanks

Dave

On Tue, 19 Jul 2016, 23:52 Ian Lance Taylor <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @davecheney <https://github.com/davecheney> The initial impetus for this
> is not a dependency management issue. It's a refactoring-large-codebase
> issue. I agree that this is completely unnecessary if you are using a
> system that has separate packages that are released on their own schedule
> and where each package importer advances to a new package on its own
> schedule. But this is for a different kind of system (one that, not
> coincidentally, is used at Google): you have a single large project that is
> composed of many different packages, where all are built and released
> simultaneously.
